Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum [inherited]
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Control.

enum GridLayout::StretchUnit [inherited]
 

Specifies, whether the stretching-parameters for the columns or rows should be interpreted in percent or as pixels.

Enumerator:
Default 
Percent  Percent.
Pixel  Pixel.

enum GridLayout::XAlign [inherited]
 

Specifies the x-alignment of a component inside a cell.

Enumerator:
XDefault  Use default-alignment (= Center).
Left  Align on the left side of the cell.
Center  Align centered inside the cell.
Right  Align on the right side of the cell.

enum GridLayout::YAlign [inherited]
 

Specifies the y-alignment of a component inside a cell.

Enumerator:
YDefault  Use default-alignment (= Middle).
Top  Align on the top of the cell.
Middle  Align in the middle of the cell.
Bottom  Align on the bottom of the cell.

GridLayout::GridLayout (  Control *  parent,
INT  row_count,
INT  col_count = 1,
Size  min_size = Size(-1,-1)
)  [inherited]
 

Parameters:
parent Parent control, where the grid layout control is embedded.
row_count Number of rows of the grid.
col_count Number of columns of the grid.
min_size Minimum size of the grid. If -1 is used for the width/height, the width/height of the client area will be used and no minimum is given. If available area is smaller than the minimum area, the layouter control automatically adds a vertical and/or horizontal position indicator so that the content can be scrolled.

GridLayout::GridLayout (   )  [inherited]
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

void GridLayout::Init (  Control *  parent,
INT  row_count,
INT  col_count = 1,
Size  min_size = Size(-1,-1)
)  [inherited]
 

Parameters:
parent Parent control, where the grid layout control is embedded.
row_count Number of rows of the grid.
col_count Number of columns of the grid.
min_size Minimum size of the grid. If -1 is used for the width/height, the width/height of the client area will be used and no minimum is given. If available area is smaller than the minimum area, the layouter control automatically adds a vertical and/or horizontal position indicator so that the content can be scrolled.

void GridLayout::SetCellProperties (  INT  row,
INT  col,
Component *  component,
XAlign  x_align = XDefault,
YAlign  y_align = YDefault
)  [inherited]
 

Sets a component into the specified cell with the given alignment

Parameters:
row Row number of the cell
col Column number of the cell
component Component which should be aligned
x_align Horizontal alignment of component within cell
y_align Vertical alignment of component within cell

void GridLayout::SetColumnProperty (  INT  col,
StretchUnit  stretch_unit,
INT  value = 0
)  [inherited]
 

Sets the property of the selected column

Parameters:
col Number of column whose properties should be changed
stretch_unit Determines whether the stretching value is given in Pixels of Percent
value Value for stretching

BOOLEAN GridLayout::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
)  [inherited]
 

Used by Aragon to fill the properties by reading out a resource file. It should not be necessary for the application developer to invoke this method in a direct manner.

Reimplemented from Control.
